attributes.comment:
Those of us who desire to adopt a Foreign Born Orphan already have significant
financial commitments along the "adoption journey", including the USCIS
Biometric Fee and Orphan Petition Fee, without the need for additional financial
burden. The increases are very substantial to what is already a very high fee.

I am also hopeful that consideration of H.R. Bill # 628 to extend the expiry of
the I-171H to 24 months will be heard by the House of Representatives soon. This
is a practical solution to the problem that most of us adopting (especially from
China) face - i.e. having to resubmit for the I-171H, thus essentially doubling
the fee as well as doubling the workload for USCIS officials. Increases to the
fee along with no change in the expiration period, will mean doubling an even
higher fee.

I trust that USCIS officials will have the good sense to PROMOTE rather than
DISSUADE adoption of foreign born orphans by considering a 5 to 8% increase in
the fee instead, coupled with an increase in time of expiration of the
I-600A/I-171H to 24 months.

Yours sincerely,

Stephen Moffitt
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Stephen R Moffitt
